message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with the construction of error-correcting codes, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The focus on sparsity and load-balancing suggests a connection to distributed systems and algorithms (cs.DS), as well as coding theory (cs.CC). The use of Reed-Solomon codes is a common technique in signal processing and communication systems (cs.SI), and the paper also involves some mathematical optimization (cs.NA).
